greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals: A(n,k) is the number of partitions of 2^n into powers of 2 less than or equal to 2^k.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: elif n<j then b(n,j):= b(n-1, j) +b(2*n, j-1)
mathematica: b[n_, j_] := Module[{nn, r}, Which[n < 0, 0, j == 0, 1, j == 1, n+1, n < j, b[n, j] = b[n-1, j]+b[2*n, j-1], True, nn = 1+Floor[n]; r := n-nn; (nn-j)*Binomial[nn, j]*Sum[Binomial[j, h]/(nn-j+h)*b[j-h+r, j]*(-1)^h, {h, 0, j-1}]]]; a[n_, k_] := If[n == 0, 1, b[2^(n-k), k]]; Table[Table[a[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 11}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 18 2013, translated from Maple *)
xref: Main diagonal and lower diagonals give: A002577, A125792, A125794.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 26 2011
